context: The word 'kuulnud' in Estonian appears to be the past tense form of the verb 'kuulma' (to hear). In the provided context, it's used with the negation structure where 'ei kuulnud absoluutselt midagi' means 'he absolutely didn't hear anything at all.' This construction shows how the adverb 'absoluutselt' modifies the negative past tense verb to emphasize complete lack of hearing or perception.
